data.title: Breakfast here is a must
data.text: Breakfast here is a must.  Their breakfast sandwiches are fabulous!  Sorry I haven't been there sooner.

data.title: Excellent sandwiches here! Awesome staff.
data.text: Stopped in here at 2:55 on Saturday afternoon. Their closing time is 3:00, but the two staff workers were very friendly and allowed us to go ahead and order and eat in. In fact, as we were eating, we counted at least 10-12 people come in and order after us-- I am thinking maybe they should just extend their hours through dinner. Ordered a sandwich (can't recall what it is called) served on a pretzel bun. The sandwich was simply awesome! Not sure why anyone would go to a chain after eating here. I got chicken tortilla soup for a side that was also very good. This is a great downtown spot with excellent food and excellent service. I wish I lived closer to this deli to be a regular, but I will definitely hit it when I am in town. Side note: they have a nice collection of vintage lunch boxes displayed on the wall.

data.title: A bit rundown inside but decent food
data.text: It is nice to have a local lunch spot downtown as opposed to the typical chains. The building is in need of some tlc, but they offer a good variety of options. Good for a quick casual lunch.

data.title: Good deal, friendly staff
data.text: We weren't very hungry and were trying to figure out what to order. The woman helping us suggested the mini combo (soup & 1/2 sandwich). Those normally come on bread but she said she could split a pretzel roll if we both wanted one.  The rolls are very good, the tomato soup tasted as good as it smelled, and the sandwich "stuff" was fresh and tasty.  I thought the prices were right for the location.  Would eat here again.

data.title: Average food at an expensive price
data.text: While our sandwich and wrap were really good for the two of us it was nearly $20 and I drank water.  The staff was friendly and helpful but there was basically no ambiance and just an expensive solution for lunch.  If they backed off on their prices a bit it sure would make more sense.

data.title: A Great Deli!
data.text: The Downtown Deli, located at 330 N. Main Street in downtown Davenport, (the corner of Main and W. 4th Street---kitty corner from St. Anthony's Church and across from the Davenport Public Library) is a great place for breakfast or lunch. They serve, coffee, hot cocoa, toast, juices and a selection of breakfast sandwiches. Their lunch menu features a myriad array of deli sandwiches, soups and salads. My favorite sandwich is their Italian beef, topped with Swiss cheese (any cheese of your choice) served with au ju on a luscious bread roll. The chili is very tasty as is their chicken tortilla soup. The atmosphere is friendly and the place is clean. There is a side room available for meetings and small get-togethers. The deli also caters. The box lunches are very good and you can choose what items to be included. They are open Monday thru Saturday from 7:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. Closed Sundays. The owner said he is strongly considering being open evening hours beginning late spring 2014. I hope he does open for the evening as the food is great and it would be nice to have another choice for dinner.

data.title: Terrific deli
data.text: The Downtown Deli features a myriad selection of sandwiches along with salads and soups. My favorite sandwich being their Italian beef which is served on a lucious bread roll, topped with Swiss cheese ( you have your choice of cheeses) and it is served with au jus. They also offer breakfast sandwiches and muffins in the morning. Coffee,hot cocoa, and soft drinks are available. The deli also caters and their box lunches are delicious; you can choose what you want included in your box lunch. The deli also has a variety of fresh baked cookies everyday; the oatmeal cookies are second to none! There is a side room available for meetings and small gatherings. Hours are 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Monday thru Satuday and they are closed on Sunday.  The owner has indicated that he will begin evening hours in the spring. The Downtown Deli has great food, a nice, friendly atmosphere and it is very clean.

data.title: Terrific Deli!
data.text: The Downtown Deli is a great place for breakfast or lunch. They serve, coffee, hot cocoa, toast, juices and a selection of breakfast sandwiches. Their lunch menu features a myriad array of deli sandwiches, soups and salads.  My favorite sandwich is their Italian beef, topped with Swiss cheese (any cheese of your choice) served with au ju on a luscious bread roll.  The chili is very tasty as is their chicken tortilla soup. The atmosphere is friendly and the place is clean. There is a side room available for meetings and small get-togethers. The deli also caters. The box lunches are very good and you can choose what items to be included. They are open Monday thru Saturday from 7:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. Closed Sundays. The owner said he is strongly considering being open evening hours beginning late spring 2014. I hope he does open for the evening as the food is great and it would be nice to have another choice for dinner other than an expensive restaurant.
